main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported at Keesler Air Force Base in Mississippi in 1952.
interesting points: Two military pilots observed a bright light moving rapidly overhead, larger than any normal aircraft light, and maneuvering in an irregular manner.
Sgt. Fowler observed several metallic, saucer-shaped objects flying in a circular pattern at a very high rate of speed, exhibiting rapid acceleration, deceleration, and pulsating motion.
The objects were estimated to be 100 to 200 feet in diameter, traveling at speeds of approximately 200-300 miles per hour, and changing color from red to green to white.
Mr. H.E. Davis, a radar instructor, and Mrs. H.E. Davis, an optical worker, observed UFOs for 5-10 minutes, with Mr. Davis being a reliable and experienced observer.
There were no explanations for the observed phenomena, no physical evidence, and no interception or identification action taken.
sighted object: various unidentified flying objects, including saucer-shaped metallic objects and bright lights
witnesses: military pilots, radar instructor, optical worker, and civilian
